clinical_study.brief_title: Measuring Cerebral Blood Flow Using Pseudo-continuous Arterial Spin Labeling Perfusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Measuring Cerebral Blood Flow Using Pseudo-continuous Arterial Spin Labeling Perfusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test a new MRI sequence that measures cerebral blood flow (CBF). Because this technique for measuring CBF is new, there is little information on what the normal values for different regions of the brain should be. Information from the study will be used to establish normative CBF values for the brain, improving the reliable use of this technique for the diagnosis of brain injury or disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Regional cerebral blood flow values of the brain measured using pseudo-continuous arterial spin labeling (pCASL) MRI.

intervention.description: All participants will have be given a MRI using a pseudo-continuous arterial spin labeling perfusion sequence.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any person between the ages of 18-90 years, who is undergoing routine magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the head with or without contrast at Loma Linda University Medical Center.
- Must be eligible for MRI (no electronic or metal implants that are not MR compatible).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Electronic or metal implant that is not MRI safe, pregnancy or claustrophobia.
